eu.geclipse.core
Class ProblemRegistry

java.lang.Object
  eu.geclipse.core.ProblemRegistry

public class ProblemRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

This is the base problem registry that is always used if no other problem registry is specified. A problem registry is used to map problem IDs to problem implementations. Therefore if asked for a problem with a specific ID it asks all registered problem providers if they are able to create such a problem. In that sense it just delegates the central problem request to the decentralised problem providers. If no problem could be found for the specified ID a default problem is generated that denotes an unknown problem.

Field Detail

UNKNOWN_PROBLEM

public static final int UNKNOWN_PROBLEM
ID for an unknown problem, i.e. a problem ID for which no problem could be found.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getRegistry

public static ProblemRegistry getRegistry()
Static access method to the singleton instance of the problem registry.

Returns:
The singleton instance of the problem registry.

createProblem

public static IProblem createProblem(int id,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     java.lang.Throwable exc,
                                     int[] solutionIDs,
                                     java.lang.String pluginID)
Create a new problem with the specified parameters. Only problem providers should use this method to create their problems.

Parameters:
id - The unique ID of the problem. In order to be sure that the ID is really unique one should make use of uniqueID().
text - A descriptive text that explains the problem.
exc - An exception that may have caused this problem. May be null.
solutionIDs - Unique IDs of the solutions of the new problem.
pluginID - The plugin ID of the plugin where this problem is defined.
Returns:
The newly created problem.

getProblem

public IProblem getProblem(int problemID,
                           java.lang.Throwable exc,
                           java.lang.String description)
Get the problem with the specified ID and apply the specified exception and description to it.

Parameters:
problemID - The unique ID of the problem.
exc - The exception that caused the problem or null.
description - A descriptive text that gives a more detailed description of the problem or null.
Returns:
The problem or a standard problem if the specified ID could not be mapped to an existing problem.

getProblem

public IProblem getProblem(int problemID,
                           java.lang.Throwable exc)
Get the problem with the specified ID and apply the specified exception to it.

Parameters:
problemID - The unique ID of the problem.
exc - The exception that caused the problem or null.
Returns:
The problem or a standard problem if the specified ID could not be mapped to an existing problem.

uniqueID

public static int uniqueID()
Get a unique ID for a problem. The returned ID is unique during runtime but may change between different sessions.

Returns:
A runtime unique ID.
